document_name_accent: ung thu co tu cung giai doan cuoi.json
document_title: Late stage cervical cancer (4): Signs and treatment
subsection_name: ung-thu-co-tu-cung-giai-doan-cuoi.json_1_Classification of stage IV cervical cancer according to FIGO
subsection_content:
Based on the classification system of the International Federation of Obstetrics and Gynecology (FIGO), doctors classify cervical cancer into 4 stages from I to IV. In particular, stage IV cervical cancer is divided into two stages IVA and IVB.
Cervical cancer stage IVA
Stage IVA is when the cancer has invaded nearby organs such as the bladder or rectum...
Cervical cancer stage IVB
Stage IVB is when the cancer has spread to distant organs, such as the lungs, liver, and bones.
See more: 4 stages of cervical cancer that women need to understand in detail.
Stage I cervical cancer; Cervical cancer stage II; Cervical cancer stage III
Not only showing local symptoms such as vaginal bleeding and pelvic pain, stage IV cervical cancer patients also have pain in many places where the cancer has metastasized.
